build.documentation: Radial build of the center stack

build.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

build.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

build.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

build.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

build.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

build.layer.documentation: List of layers in the center stack

build.layer[:].start_radius.documentation: Start radius of the layer layer

build.layer[:].end_radius.documentation: End radius of the layer layer

build.layer[:].type.documentation:
Center-stack type code
0) vacuum (use this to set mimimum radius for OH)
1) OH
2) TF
3) BL
4) Shielding
5) Wall
-1) Vacuum vessel

build.layer[:].identifier.documentation: Integer to identify the same layer on the high-field-side and low-field-side

build.layer[:].hfs.documentation: Integer set to -1 if layer is on the high-field-side and 1 if layer is on the low-field-side. 0 when not applicable (eg. vessel, OH, and cryostat)

build.layer[:].shape.documentation:
Integer to identify the physical shape of the layer
1)Priceton D (shape_parameters = [])
2) rectangle  (shape_parameters = [height])
3) tripple-arc (shape_parameters = [h, small_radius, mid_radius, small_coverage, mid_coverage])

build.layer[:].shape_parameters.documentation: List of the shape specific parameters for given shape type

build.layer[:].outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the limiting surface. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours

build.flux_swing_requirements.rampup.documentation: Total flux required for the plasma rampup

build.flux_swing_requirements.flattop.documentation: Total flux required for the plasma flattop

build.flux_swing_requirements.pf.documentation: Contribution of vertical field from PF coils to flux swing

build.oh.required_b_field.documentation: Magnetic field in the OH solenoid required to satisfy rampup and flattop flux consumption

build.oh.required_j.documentation: Current density in the OH solenoid required to satisfy rampup and flattop flux consumption

build.pf_coils_rail.documentation: List of rails where the PF coils can slide on

build.pf_coils_rail[:].coils_elements_ar.documentation: Cross-sectional area taken up by individual filaments in a coil

build.pf_coils_rail[:].coils_cleareance.documentation: Clereance that coils have from other structures

build.pf_coils_rail[:].name.documentation: Name of the pf coil rail

build.pf_coils_rail[:].coils_number.documentation: Number of coils on the rail

build.pf_coils_rail[:].outline.documentation: Irregular (possibly not-continuous) outline of the rail surface

build.pf_coils_rail[:].outline.distance.documentation: Distance along the rail skipping gaps

build.tf.coils_n.documentation: Number of coils around the torus

build.tf.thickness.documentation: Toroidal Thickness of the TF coils

build.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

build.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

build.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

build.ids_properties.homogeneous_time.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

build.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

build.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

build.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

build.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

build.ids_properties.version_put.access_.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

build.ids_properties.version_put.data_di.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS
